title: 2023 Porsche 911 Sport Classic
description: This 2023 Porsche is #516 of the 1,250 911 Sport Classic examples produced worldwide, all of which link a Turbo-specification twin-turbocharged 3.7L flat-six to a seven-speed manual transaxle and rear-wheel drive. This example is finished in Sport Gray Metallic over Black and Classic Cognac Heritage Design leather and Pepita cloth, and equipment includes Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes, 20" and 21" Sport Classic wheels, Power Steering Plus, power-adjustable front seats, a High-End Burmester sound system, and Porsche Communication Management with navigation. This 992.1 Sport Classic has 258 miles and is now offered with a window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New York title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 2023 Porsche 911 Sport Classic at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #201,587.
text: This 2023 Porsche is #516 of the 1,250 911 Sport Classic examples produced worldwide, all of which link a Turbo-specification twin-turbocharged 3.7L flat-six to a seven-speed manual transaxle and rear-wheel drive. This example is finished in Sport Gray Metallic over Black and Classic Cognac Heritage Design leather and Pepita cloth, and equipment includes Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes, 20″ and 21″ Sport Classic wheels, Power Steering Plus, power-adjustable front seats, a High-End Burmester sound system, and Porsche Communication Management with navigation. This 992.1 Sport Classic has 258 miles and is now offered with a window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New York title. The 911 Sport Classic is based on the 911 Turbo S and pays tribute to the 911 Carrera RS 2.7 from the 1970s with its distinctive ducktail spoiler as well as retro design elements including Fuchs-style alloy wheels and gold badging. This example is finished in Sport Gray Metallic (LM7M) and features a carbon-fiber roof with a double-bubble, fog lights, a Porsche Heritage rear grille badge, and front and rear parking sensors. The front of the car is wrapped in XPEL paint-protection film. Center-locking 20″ and 21″ Sport Classic wheels are mounted with Pirelli P Zero tires. Stopping power is provided by Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB) with black-finished multi-piston calipers. The car is equipped with Power Steering Plus, Porsche Active Suspension Management, and rear-axle steering. In the cabin, the Sport Classic features Classic Cognac and Black leather upholstery along with Paldao wood trim and Pepita cloth inserts on the seats and door panels. The car was optioned with a Burmester surround-sound system. A plaque mounted on the dashboard denotes this example as #516 of 1,250 units produced. The GT Sport steering wheel is trimmed in black leather, and instrumentation includes a central tachometer flanked by configurable TFT displays. The digital odometer indicates 258 miles. The twin-turbocharged 3.7L flat-six was factory rated at 543 horsepower and 442 lb-ft of torque, which is routed to the rear wheels through a seven-speed manual transaxle. An oil change was performed in May 2024. The window sticker shows initial delivery to Porsche Gold Coast in Jericho, New York, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $279,510. The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage. There is currently a lien out on the title to the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be repaid before the title can be transferred to a new owner. You are not connected to real-time updates. html:
This 2023 Porsche is #516 of the 1,250 911 Sport Classic examples produced worldwide, all of which link a Turbo-specification twin-turbocharged 3.7L flat-six to a seven-speed manual transaxle and rear-wheel drive. This example is finished in Sport Gray Metallic over Black and Classic Cognac Heritage Design leather and Pepita cloth, and equipment includes Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes, 20″ and 21″ Sport Classic wheels, Power Steering Plus, power-adjustable front seats, a High-End Burmester sound system, and Porsche Communication Management with navigation. This 992.1 Sport Classic has 258 miles and is now offered with a window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New York title.

The 911 Sport Classic is based on the 911 Turbo S and pays tribute to the 911 Carrera RS 2.7 from the 1970s with its distinctive ducktail spoiler as well as retro design elements including Fuchs-style alloy wheels and gold badging.

This example is finished in Sport Gray Metallic (LM7M) and features a carbon-fiber roof with a double-bubble, fog lights, a Porsche Heritage rear grille badge, and front and rear parking sensors. The front of the car is wrapped in XPEL paint-protection film.

Center-locking 20″ and 21″ Sport Classic wheels are mounted with Pirelli P Zero tires. Stopping power is provided by Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB) with black-finished multi-piston calipers. The car is equipped with Power Steering Plus, Porsche Active Suspension Management, and rear-axle steering.

In the cabin, the Sport Classic features Classic Cognac and Black leather upholstery along with Paldao wood trim and Pepita cloth inserts on the seats and door panels. The car was optioned with a Burmester surround-sound system.

A plaque mounted on the dashboard denotes this example as #516 of 1,250 units produced.

The GT Sport steering wheel is trimmed in black leather, and instrumentation includes a central tachometer flanked by configurable TFT displays. The digital odometer indicates 258 miles.

The twin-turbocharged 3.7L flat-six was factory rated at 543 horsepower and 442 lb-ft of torque, which is routed to the rear wheels through a seven-speed manual transaxle. An oil change was performed in May 2024.

The window sticker shows initial delivery to Porsche Gold Coast in Jericho, New York, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $279,510.

The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage.

There is currently a lien out on the title to the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be repaid before the title can be transferred to a new owner.
